fields.summary: Target option on Insert Link does not work
Answers are not counted in the user popup window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47094].
  {panel}

To repro:

# Goto profile.
# Edit Organisation field.
# Press save.
# Witness the 500 error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47085].
  {panel}

I am trying to add the following text (some links are lost in this report) to the question here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/32875/can-a-user-with-a-disabled-account-browse-anonymously

Logging in / Logging out - doesn't work.

I've managed to submit the same text (slightly reformatted) from Safari.

===
Well, my first attempt at the answer would be... ask TechTime? Oh, wait, that's us :) Thanks for linking!

So, let's try this again...

1) It is possible to force IOPlex Jespa (the library that actually does NTLM authenticaton under the bonnet) to install an anonymous identitiy into the session on logout. This will prevent users from getting logged in again immediately after explicit logout, but it will also remove the possibility of logging back in again by just clicking on anything outside of logout page. If you do want to go this route, just add/change this in Jespa filter definition in web.xml:

        <init-param>
            <param-name>http.parameter.anonymous.name</param-name>
            <param-value>logout</param-value>
        </init-param>
        <init-param>
            <param-name>http.parameter.logout.name</param-name>
            <param-value>logout</param-value>
        </init-param>
        <init-param>
            <param-name>fallback.location</param-name>
            <param-value>/login.action?logout=true</param-value>
        </init-param>

This tells Jespa 3 things: 
- if you see logout parameter in the URL, do logout. 
- If you see logout parameter in the URL install anonymous identity
- if for some reason authentication fails - go to login form and install anonymous identity while you are at it

2) This specific use case is valid IMHO, disabled users should NOT be logged in into Jira/Confluence even if they pass NTLM authentication. I will add logic to handle this into our plugin. Watch this space!


===

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47082]. {panel} This bug can be easily reproduced via the following steps. These steps reference answers.atlassian.com for simplicity, but the bug affects all instances of Confluence Questions. 1. Load an anonymous/incognito browser window 2. Go to [https://answers.atlassian.com]. Observe that the "Popular" filter is selected by default. 3. Open the developer tools and view network traffic (filter to only show XHR traffic) 4. Click on the "Unanswered" filter. Observe that a request to [https://answers.atlassian.com/rest/questions/1.0/questions/?startIndex=0&pageSize=20&filter=unanswered] is made. 5. Scroll to the bottom of the page and trigger the 'infinite scroll'. Observe that a request to [https://answers.atlassian.com/rest/questions/1.0/questions/?startIndex=20&pageSize=15&filter=popular] is made. Not that in Step 5, the browser requests the "popular" filter, but the user has switched to the "unanswered" filter view. The result is that the second page of results displayed in the list does not actually match the view to which they are inserted. This is obvious in the "unanswered" case, because the second page of results may contain questions that are actually answered. This bug occurs due to an incorrect use of the jQuery API in {{questionlist.js}}. 1. When the page is loaded, the selected filter is inserted into the DOM as a data attribute on the main {{cq-questionlist}} element, like so: {code}
    ...
{code} 2. When the active filter is changed by the user, the current filter is retrieved using {{$(".cq-questionlist").data("filter")}} and then, after the update is successful, the DOM is updated to have the new current filter using {{$(".cq-questionlist").attr("data-filter", "unanswered")}}. 3. When the infinite scroll is triggered, the current filter is again retrieved using {{$(".cq-questionlist").data("filter")}}. Savvy jQuery users may notice the problem immediately. The filter value is updated using the {{attr}} function, but the filter value is only ever retrieved using the {{data}} function. This doesn't work as expected because the {{data}} function only queries the corresponding DOM attribute _the first time that the data value is populated_ (see [https://api.jquery.com/data/]): {quote} The data- attributes are pulled in the first time the data property is accessed and then are no longer accessed or mutated (all data values are then stored internally in jQuery). {quote} Subsequent updates to the DOM will not affect the value stored internally by jQuery for the "filter" data value. Thus, the infinite scroll will continue to use the original filter value when the page was first loaded.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47048].
  {panel}

My first time posting an answer I did not have a display name set so it was blank. I posted an answer then I realized it posted my real name. I so quickly went to my profile to see if I could change my real name. I see that a new required field "Display Name" was added. So I added my alias and went back to the post hoping that it would be updated correctly. My real name was still shown. So I deleted my comment and reposted it thinking it was a cache issue. Even after making a new post the alias was not used.

So as a work around I changed my real name to my alias so now my real name and alias is the set to my alias.

BTW you should note that there is a note that says your personal information will never be shown to the public or something to that effect. THIS IS A LIE as my information WAS exposed.

Just so you have additional information here is my post:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/160328/json-parse-error-on-atlassian

I also just noticed that my real name is still stored and displayed on hover of my name and when you click my name the URL is my name 

https://answers.atlassian.com/users/40704/<FIRST>%20<LAST>/

This unacceptable. I am going to delete my account from answers until this is fixed. My privacy has been violated

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47040].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

1) add a comment to invoke the editor;
2) paste some URL and press 'space' to turn it into a link
3) attempt to modify the text of the link by:
     a) putting the cursor in the link text
     b) clicking on the 'link' icon
     c) reading the 'Title' (FAILS: there is no text in the 'Title')
     d) setting the 'Title' and clicking 'OK' (FAILS: the link text is not updated
4) swear a bit and wonder how the company which made Confluence could make this.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The _Popular Label_ macro isn't returning any questions associated with the specified label from _Confluence Questions_ plugin.

h3. Environment
Tested with Confluence Questions plugin version 2.4.4.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Add _Popular Label_ macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/popular-labels-macro-168003614.html] in your Confluence page.
# Specify a label that are associated with questions your _Confluence Questions_ plugin.

h3. Expected Results
Questions associated with the specified labels should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Questions associated with the specified labels are not displayed.
fields.summary: Questions don't Appear in Popular Label Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47027].
{panel}
Hi !
 I am writing this email to let you know of a Stored XSS Vulnerability that i found on atlassian.com .
 You will have the POC as an atachment to this report that i am making.

Now i will show you in details how i managed to find this vulnerability.
 Firstly I created an account in atlassian.com . When i created my account i set the full name to : "><svg/onload=confirm(document.domain)>;
 Then under my services, i went to [https://answers.atlassian.com/] 
 and when the page fully loaded, the javascript payload that was in my full name was executed and i got the result shown in the attachment image. 
 I also uploaded another image as an atachment showing to you the user cookies which you can get by just replacing document.domain with document.cookie on the payload.

Regards,
 Andi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47021].
  {panel}

User content uploaded onto answers.atlassian.com is indexable by Google due to the lack of appropriate indexing rules such as those in /robots.txt.

Additionally, such content being indexed can be removed from Google by consulting Google's Webmaster tools.

An example of indexable content is below:

Search Query: site:https://answers.atlassian.com/upfiles + password
Image of results:
!http://i.imgur.com/lj8TZdY.png!

The security risk of this is quite low, however, if sensitive files do lie in /upfiles, they have been indexed by Google and will be easier to find by attackers.
fields.summary: Indexable User Content (Attachments) on Google

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47008].
  {panel}

h3.Summary:
Confluence Questions exposes a public sitemap that shows created questions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Install Confluence Questions.
# Make a question.
# Access confluence address + /plugins/servlet/questions/sitemap-questions.xml.
#* Ex: https://aschneider.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/questions/sitemap-questions.xml

!2201.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
This access should be restricted.

h3. Actual Results
Public users have access to this page.
fields.summary: Confluence Questions exposes a public sitemap.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-47007].
  {panel}

Log into Answer.atlassian.com
Navigate to my question, click moderate, click edit
Arrive at this URL https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/182621/edit/
Edit summary, description and tags
Enter description of my change
Click Save Edit

Result:
"500 Server Error
Sorry, you've encountered a system error."

And the page shows me as logged out (Log In link appears in the top right corner).  Same thing happens if I click Cancel instead of Save Edit. Tried in both Chrome and IE 10. Same behavior.
fields.summary: Clicking Save Edit after editing my question results in 500 error and does not save my edits

fields.description:
When I go to my profile page it shows "Votes Left Today: 30" just right of my mugshot (well, the mugshot of my dog, she's much prettier than I am...).
If I then click any of the "Recent Activity", "Reputation History", "Votes", or "Favorites" tabs, the number is gone, only "Votes Left Today: " is shown.
Click on the "Overview" tab and the number will magically reappear.
fields.summary: Disappearing "Votes Left Today"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46997].
  {panel}

When not signed in, up-voting a request pops up a nice box prompting for login...link to create account takes you to another nice box to collect needed info...and then it dies:
FF 10.0.2 = nothing happens...at all (my FF is super locked-down so who knows).

Chrome 17.0.963.56 and Safari 5.1.1: spits out a 75% hidden message in the upper left hand corner.  Can't read it, but clicking the button (can only read the last letter "k") or not clicking it and refreshing, yields nothing.  Clicking on it does trigger some sort of failed event loop as the next time you click on vote up, it throws the message:
Sorry but anonymous users cannot vote.
Please login or create an account here.
and clicking the "here" sends you off to the proper sign-up page.

Ref. screenshot for better description.
fields.summary: Upvoting post when not logged in, then going to create an account is broken.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46989].
  {panel}

*Update*:
We've now published a guide for marketing a plugin:
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/MARKET/Plugin+Marketing

We've previously encouraged plugin vendors to use the forums to advertise their plugins - and it makes sense for them to have a place where they can do this. Unfortunately, this doesn't map so well to Answers - e.g. https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/2278/free-requirement-management-for-jira-studio .

Could we perhaps have a single forum remaining open for plugin vendors, or some guidance on the correct way to use Answers for advertising?
fields.summary: Answers provides no valid way for vendors to advertise plugins
